intro: Theobroma nitidum, commonly known as cupuacu, is a small evergreen tree native to the Amazon basin. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is closely related to the cacao tree. The plant produces large, yellowish flowers that give way to fruit with a thick, fibrous pulp containing edible seeds. Theobroma nitidum is valued for its fruit, which is rich in antioxidants and has a sweet, aromatic flavor. It also has traditional uses in medicine and as a source of natural ingredients in cosmetics.
